=== The Collection PPA ===

Below is a collection of '''Ubuntu Touch apps''' being developed, their current state of packaging and availability in the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-touch-coreapps-drivers/+archive/collection|Collection PPA]]</nowiki>. A PPA (Personal Packaging Archive) is a repository of third-party packages used to distribute apps that are not part of Ubuntu proper.  

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="background: #ECA918; color: #000; margin: 2em 1em;" style="padding: 0.5em 1em;">'''Please note:''' These apps are provided as-is, there is no security or performance review by anybody but the original author. Do not install these apps unless you understand the potential risks to your computer or device.
|}

With that said, you can install the applications by running the following commands in a terminal:

''Run this command only if you are installing the apps on a mobile device via SSH'': <code>sudo apt-get install software-properties-common</code>

<pre>
    sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-touch-coreapps-drivers/collection
    sudo apt-get update
</pre>

After this, you can run the <code>sudo apt-get install $APPNAME</code> command, where you can replace <code>$APPNAME</code> by a space-separated list of apps you want to install. You'll find the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-touch-coreapps-drivers/+archive/collection?field.series_filter=raring|list of apps as packages here]]</nowiki>.

{*} '''For developers:''' if you're looking to get your application in this PPA, add it to the list and we'll get to it as soon as we can. If you include packaging in your branch then we'll get to it quicker!

{*} '''Questions?''' if you've got any questions about this collection of Ubuntu Touch apps, or about app development in Ubuntu, you can join and <nowiki>[[https://plus.google.com/communities/111350780270925540549|ask our community of developers]]</nowiki>.
